The plant has a dense, carpet-like growth habit with a pale green to silvery appearance due to its finely textured leaves. Its leaves are usually less than 1 cm in length and are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Hymenophyllum perfissum is characterized by its unique reproductive structures called gemmae, which are produced in specialized clusters called gemma cups.
